Interface_name: WebSocket Client-side based on browser native API in JavaScript
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket client class in JavaScript that manages WebSocket connections with support for reconnection, message handling, and connection lifecycle events.

Class Description: The `N` class represents a WebSocket client that connects to a specified URL, handles incoming messages, manages connection state, and provides automatic reconnection capabilities. It supports event callbacks for connection establishment and completion, and can pipe received data to a destination.

Attributes:
- url: [String] - The WebSocket server URL to connect to
- options: [Object] - Configuration options including protocols, reconnect interval, and callbacks
- socket: [WebSocket|null] - The active WebSocket connection instance
- streaming: [Boolean] - Flag indicating if the connection is active
- callbacks: [Object] - Collection of event callback arrays (connect, data)
- destination: [Object|null] - Target to pipe received data to
- reconnectInterval: [Number] - Time in seconds between reconnection attempts
- shouldAttemptReconnect: [Boolean] - Flag controlling reconnection behavior
- completed: [Boolean] - Connection completion state
- established: [Boolean] - Connection establishment state
- progress: [Number] - Connection progress indicator
- reconnectTimeoutId: [Number] - Timer ID for reconnection attempts
- onEstablishedCallback: [Function|null] - Called when connection is established
- onCompletedCallback: [Function|null] - Called when connection completes
- hookOnEstablished: [Function|null] - Optional hook for connection establishment

Methods:
- constructor(url, options) -> [N] - Initializes the WebSocket client with URL and options
- connect(destination) -> [void] - Sets the destination for received data
- destroy() -> [void] - Cleans up resources and closes the connection
- start() -> [void] - Initiates the WebSocket connection with optional protocols
- resume() -> [void] - Placeholder for resuming functionality (currently empty)
- onOpen() -> [void] - Handles WebSocket open event, updates progress
- onClose() -> [void] - Handles WebSocket close/error events, manages reconnection
- onMessage(message) -> [void] - Handles incoming messages, triggers establishment callbacks
